remixlab.proscene
Class InteractiveCameraFrame

java.lang.Object
  remixlab.proscene.Frame
      remixlab.proscene.InteractiveFrame
          remixlab.proscene.InteractiveCameraFrame
All Implemented Interfaces:
java.lang.Cloneable, MouseGrabber
public class InteractiveCameraFrame
extends InteractiveFrame

The InteractiveCameraFrame class represents a InteractiveFrame with Camera specific mouse bindings.

A InteractiveCameraFrame is a specialization of a InteractiveFrame, designed to be set as the Camera.frame(). Mouse motions are basically interpreted in a negated way: when the mouse goes to the right, the InteractiveFrame translation goes to the right, while the InteractiveCameraFrame has to go to the left, so that the scene seems to move to the right.

A InteractiveCameraFrame rotates around its revolveAroundPoint(), which corresponds to the associated Camera.revolveAroundPoint().

A InteractiveCameraFrame can also "fly" in the scene. It basically moves forward, and turns according to the mouse motion. See flySpeed(), flyUpVector() and the Scene.MouseAction.MOVE_FORWARD and Scene.MouseAction.MOVE_BACKWARD.

Constructor Detail

InteractiveCameraFrame

public InteractiveCameraFrame()
Default constructor.

flySpeed() is set to 0.0 and flyUpVector() is (0,1,0). The revolveAroundPoint() is set to (0,0,0).

Attention: Created object is InteractiveFrame.removeFromMouseGrabberPool().

public InteractiveCameraFrame clone()
Implementation of the clone method.

Calls InteractiveFrame.clone() and makes a deep copy of the remaining object attributes.

Overrides:

See Also:

spin

public void spin()
Overloading of InteractiveFrame.spin().

Rotates the InteractiveCameraFrame around its #revolveAroundPoint() instead of its origin.

Overrides:
spin in class InteractiveFrame

setFlySpeed

public void setFlySpeed(float speed)
Sets the flySpeed(), defined in processing scene units.

Default value is 0.0, but it is modified according to the Scene.radius() when the InteractiveCameraFrame is set as the Camera.frame().

flyUpVector

public processing.core.PVector flyUpVector()
Returns the up vector used in fly mode, expressed in the world coordinate system.

Fly mode corresponds to the Scene.MouseAction.MOVE_FORWARD and Scene.MouseAction.MOVE_BACKWARD remixlab.proscene.Scene.MouseAction bindings. In these modes, horizontal displacements of the mouse rotate the InteractiveCameraFrame around this vector. Vertical displacements rotate always around the Camera X axis.

Default value is (0,1,0), but it is updated by the Camera when set as its Camera.frame(). Camera.setOrientation(Quaternion) and Camera.setUpVector(PVector) modify this value and should be used instead.

setFlyUpVector

public void setFlyUpVector(processing.core.PVector up)
Sets the flyUpVector(), defined in the world coordinate system.

Default value is (0,1,0), but it is updated by the Camera when set as its Camera.frame(). Use Camera.setUpVector(PVector) instead in that case.

revolveAroundPoint

public processing.core.PVector revolveAroundPoint()
Returns the point the InteractiveCameraFrame revolves around when rotated.

It is defined in the world coordinate system. Default value is (0,0,0).

When the InteractiveCameraFrame is associated to a Camera, Camera.revolveAroundPoint() also returns this value.

flyUpdate

public void flyUpdate()
Called for continuous frame motion in fly mode (see Scene.MOVE_FORWARD).

setRevolveAroundPoint

public void setRevolveAroundPoint(processing.core.PVector revolveAroundPoint)
Sets the revolveAroundPoint(), defined in the world coordinate system.

mouseMoveEvent

public void mouseMoveEvent(java.awt.event.MouseEvent event,
                           Camera camera)
Overloading of InteractiveFrame.mouseMoveEvent(MouseEvent, Camera).

Motion depends on mouse binding. The resulting displacements are basically inverted from those of an InteractiveFrame.

Specified by:
mouseMoveEvent in interface MouseGrabber

mouseWheelEvent

public void mouseWheelEvent(java.awt.event.MouseWheelEvent event,
                            Camera camera)
Overloading of InteractiveFrame.mouseWheelEvent(MouseWheelEvent, Camera).

The wheel behavior depends on the wheel binded action. Current possible actions are ZOOM, MOVE_FORWARD, MOVE_BACKWARD. ZOOM speed depends on #wheelSensitivity() MOVE_FORWARD and MOVE_BACKWARD depend on #flySpeed().

Specified by:
mouseWheelEvent in interface MouseGrabber
Overrides:
mouseWheelEvent in class InteractiveFrame
See Also:
InteractiveFrame.setWheelSensitivity(float)
